action.action-desc: Mr. Cartwright (for himself, Mr. Carson, Ms. Titus, Ms. Jackson Lee, Mr. Kim of New Jersey, Mr. Wittman, Ms. Ross, Ms. Lee of Pennsylvania, Mr. Fitzpatrick, Ms. Norton, Mr. Kilmer, Mr. Case, Mr. Lieu, Mr. Trone, Ms. Williams of Georgia, Mrs. Watson Coleman, Mr. Johnson of Georgia, Mr. Carl, Mr. Norcross, Ms. Sherrill, Mr. Bishop of Georgia, Mrs. Torres of California, Mr. Morelle, Mr. Gottheimer, Mr. Landsman, Mr. Crow, Mr. Moskowitz, Ms. Tokuda, Mr. Thompson of Mississippi, Ms. Kuster, Mr. Schiff, Ms. Crockett, Ms. Wexton, Mr. Vicente Gonzalez of Texas, Ms. Craig, Mr. McGarvey, Mr. Ryan, Ms. Budzinski, and Mr. Mrvan) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Veterans' Affairs

form.official-title: To amend title 38, United States Code, to improve the VA Work-Study program.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the VA Work-Study Improvement Act.

subsection.text: Subsection (a)(5) of section 3485 of title 38, United States Code, is amended by adding at the end the following new subparagraph:

subparagraph.text: Any other activity at an agency of a State or local government or a nonprofit organization that would benefit, directly or indirectly, veterans or members of the Armed Forces.

subsection.text: Paragraph (7) of subsection (a) of such section is amended to read as follows:

subparagraph.text: The term applicable hourly minimum wages means the higher of the following wages:

clause.text: The minimum rate of basic pay for any Federal employee under the General Schedule or the Federal Wage System pursuant to parts 530 and 532 of title 5, Code of Federal Regulations.
The hourly minimum wage under comparable law of the State in which the services are to be performed.
The hourly minimum wage under comparable law of the local government with jurisdiction over the area in which the services are to be performed.

subparagraph.text: The term rate of basic pay has the meaning given such term in section 8331 of title 5.

subsection.text: Such section is amended by adding at the end the following new subsection:

paragraph.text: an individual participating in a qualifying work-study activity may electronically record the hours worked under such activity; and
the supervisor of such individual may electronically approve such records.

subsection.text: Such section, as amended by subsection (c), is further amended by adding at the end the following new subsection:
On an annual basis, the Secretary shall publish the following information regarding qualifying work-study activities carried out during the covered year:

paragraph.text: The number of individuals who participated in a qualifying work-study activity.
The wages paid to such individuals.
The number of hours worked by such individuals.
A list of the participating educational institutions.

subsection.text: The amendments made by this Act shall apply with respect to a payment of work-study allowance made under section 3485 of title 38, United States Code, on or after January 1, 2026.
